Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2012 08:58AM Sanibelblueyezz wrote: I've never had anybody say anything rude like that to me in the infusion room. I don't tell people what stage I am be wise they would freak out or it would be too hard to explain. They just put up big flat screen tvs on the walls in one waiting room & the infusion room. To me they are annoying. They keep it on silent with texting on. I try to find a seat in the middle away from the tvs. There was once a couple that came in & the wife would bring him a cooler of food & wait on him. Once their 2 sons came & it was like a party just for them. I was not feeling well & just wanted to rest & I quietly called a nurse over & asked if she could talk to them to quiet them down. They obliged quietly & they haven't had any parties since. I don't mind chatting but I'd rather sit there quietly & rest or sleep.
Posts.Title: Infusion Center Moments blainejennifer Fitztwins

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2012 11:18AM Sanibelblueyezz wrote: I have been on chemotherapy since January & am very happy with my port. I would have no veins otherwise. I have had no problems with it at all. Good luck with your decision. Marilyn

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2012 01:29PM Sanibelblueyezz wrote: A time bomb ticking away with no way to tell when it will go off. I try to live as normally as possible but it's always there ticking away counting my days. I can't be completely safe & happy; although I do live life. Blessings to all. Marilyn
